22.text:
The bond between pets and owners are often
filled with love and affection so it is no

27.text:
surprise that these brave animals risked their
lives to save someone else’s. Here are 5

31.text: animals who saved people from death.

34.text: Number 5 – Pig Saves Owner From Heart Attack

37.text:
A pot-bellied pig named LuLu, did the unthinkable
when she saved her owner’s mother from a

42.text:
heart attack. Lulu the pig noticed that something
was not right with JoAnn Altsman as she had

47.text:
collapsed to the ground. In an attempt to
save her life, Lulu the pig went outside,

52.text:
pushed the gate and proceeded to risk her
life by walking onto the road. Whenever she

57.text:
could see an approaching car, she immediately
would lay down to try and get the car to stop.

61.text:
When nobody stopped, she got up to regularly
check on JoAnn. She continued this routine

65.text:
for 45 minutes until one motorist stopped
to see what was wrong with the pig. Lulu then

70.text:
showed the motorist the collapsed body of
JoAnn and the motorist immediately notified

73.text:
the paramedics. JoAnn was rushed to hospital
where she was treated. As a reward for Lulu’s

78.text:
heroic efforts, she was rewarded her favourite
treat, a jelly doughnut.

84.text: Number 4 – Dog Saves Woman From River

87.text:
Brenda Owens was taking her lunchtime walk
with her Labrador Retriever named Penny when

92.text:
all of a sudden, she spotted a wheelchair
on the riverbank. That’s when Brenda noticed

96.text:
a woman floating in the water. Brenda shouted
at the woman, "Are you all right love?" but

100.text:
got no response. That’s when she decided
to take matters to her own hands. Brenda told

105.text:
her dog Penny to “Fetch! Fetch!” The obedient
dog immediately jumped into the fast flowing

110.text:
river and pulled the unconscious woman to
shore. Brenda was then able to resuscitate

113.text:
the woman, and after 5 minutes she began to
breathe again. Once the woman was breathing

117.text:
again, Brenda placed her in the recovery position
and called for emergency help.

126.text:
Depending on how pitbulls are brought up,
pitbulls have a reputation of being these

131.text:
violent, nasty dogs who bite and attack people
but this pitbull defied that reputation to

136.text:
say the least. Angela was leaving a playground
with her toddler son in Port Charlotte when

139.text:
all of a sudden, a man approached Angela in
the parking lot with a knife, telling her

143.text:
not to make any noise or sudden movement.
This is when a lost dog came to the rescue

147.text:
and charged at the armed man, who fled as
a result. The dog didn’t physically attack

151.text:
the man but it went up to him showing signs
of aggression, baring his teeth and growling

155.text:
and barking. The dog was transported to a
local shelter and if his owners didn’t step

159.text:
forward within five days, Angela and her family
planned to adopt their saviour she named “Angel.”

164.text:
Animal control officers and shelter workers
believe Angel is lost, and not a stray, because

168.text:
of his good health, sturdy weight and mild
temperament.

172.text:
Number 2 – Gorilla Saves Boy From Other
Gorillas

175.text:
Gorillas are very intelligent animals and
this was proven when one gorilla saved the

179.text:
life of a 3-year-old boy. On August 16 1996
in the Brookfield Zoo, a 3-year-old boy fell

186.text:
into a Gorilla enclosure and lost consciousness.
This attracted all the attention of the other

190.text:
gorillas who went to investigate. However,
Binti, an 8-year-old ape saw the motionless

195.text:
boy and picked him up. The ape cuddled the
boy gently in her arms, protecting him from

199.text:
the other apes. She carried the boy 60 feet
to an entrance where zoo-keepers were able

203.text:
to safely retrieve the boy. The boy was then
taken to the hospital where he recovered fully.

208.text: Meanwhile, the ape was praised for this rescue.

212.text: Number 1 – Lions Saves Girl From Kidnappers

215.text:
When you think of an animal who could potentially
save your life, a lion would definitely not

221.text:
be in that list. For this special case, a
group of lions did just that. In south-west

226.text:
Ethiopia, a 12-year-old girl was snatched
by four men on her way home from school. As

230.text:
the men were being pursued by the police,
they encountered a group of lions. The group

234.text:
of lions chased away the kidnappers and stayed
with the girl without harming her at all until

239.text:
the police arrived. When the police arrived,
the lions left the girl and went into the

243.text:
forest. The girl told the police she had been
beaten by her kidnappers, but no harm was

247.text:
done to her by the lions. A wildlife expert
from Ethiopia argues that the lions spared

252.text:
her because her cries sounded like a mewing
lion cub.
